text.0: offer to agni o my friends your seemly food your seemly praise.
text.1: to him supremest oer the folk the son of strength the mighty lord.
text.2: him in whose presence when they meet in full assembly men rejoice.
text.3: even him whom worthy ones inflame and living creatures bring to life.
text.4: when we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men.
text.5: he by the might of splendour grasps the holy ordinances rein.
text.6: he gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar.
text.7: when he the bright unchanged by eld consumes the sovrans of the wood.
text.8: he in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat.
text.9: on him is their high kin have they mounted as ridges on the earth.
text.10: whom sought of many mortal man hath found to be the stay of all.
text.11: he who gives flavour to our food the home of every man that lives.
text.12: even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness.
text.13: with flashing teeth and beard of gold deft with his unabated might.
text.14: for him to whom bright as an axe he as to atri hath flashed forth.
text.15: hath the wellbearing mother borne producing when her time is come.
text.16: agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support.
text.17: bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.
text.18: such zeal hath he resistless one he gained the cattle given by thee.
text.19: agni may atri overcome the dasyus who bestow no gifts subdue the men who give no food.
